pullRequest.body:
introduce `Prop`-valued mixin `PNatPowAssoc` and show that power-associativity holds for semigroups.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Can we add a `ppow_eq_pow` in the monoid case in this PR also? That seems quite important

> Can we add a `ppow_eq_pow` in the monoid case in this PR also? That seems quite important

Yes, I added it at the end.

I believe this is now mergeable. @eric-wieser, do you agree?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
instance (M : Type u) [Semigroup M] : PNatPowAssoc M where
    ppow_add k n x := semigroup_ppow_add x k n
    ppow_one := ppowRec_one
```
or something like this should be possible
Thanks, I turned the proof into a fun.
I know you said simp tags are TODO but really this should always be simp no matter what design decisions you make about the rest!
Thank you, I should have paid more attention to what lemmas get tags.
not sure about the name of this one, maybe it should be protected in the Semigroup namespace or private or something
That is a good idea.  I have added a namespace.

```suggestion
  power-associativity, but we have found that it is not hard to write.
```

Unfortunately this instance is bad, it creates an instance diamond (with `import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Pi`):

```lean
example {Î¹ : Type*} (M : Î¹ â†’ Type*) [Î  i, Semigroup (M i)] :
  (instPowPNat _ : Pow (Î  i, M i) â„•+) = Pi.instPow := rfl -- fails
```

The two ways to fix this are either:
* Don't make this an `instance`
* Add a `pnpow` field to `Semigroup`
Ah, I think I see why monoids are defined the way they are.  I will try to change the definition of semigroup.
https://arxiv.org/abs/2108.10700 has a short section (section 5) on pretty much that reason (substituting `npow` for `nsmul`), in case you're interested.
Since other people seem to be working on the refactoring of semigroups, I will leave it to them.  I've removed the bad instance, and the ppowRec material that became superfluous.
`PowAssoc` is not a great name for this file since it doesn't make clear that this is about `PNat` powers (or semigroup powers, or I don't know). Can you come up with something clearer?
I hope the new name is okay.

```suggestion
theorem ppow_mul_comm [PNatPowAssoc M] (m n : â„•+) (x : M) :
```
to match `pow_mul_comm`
Done!

This is backwards WRT `mul_assoc`:
```suggestion
theorem ppow_mul_assoc [PNatPowAssoc M] (k m n : â„•+) (x : M) :
    (x ^ k * x ^ m) * x ^ n = x ^ k * (x ^ m * x ^ n) := by
```
Thank you.  That is a good catch.
Can you add the trivial instances for `Prod` and `Pi`?
Done!
This is now innaccurate, right?
Thank you, I have removed it.

```suggestion
instance Pi.instPNatPowAssoc {I : Type*} {f : I â†’ Type*} [âˆ€ i, Mul <| f i] [âˆ€ i, Pow (f i) â„•+]
```

```suggestion
    [âˆ€ i, PNatPowAssoc <| f i] : PNatPowAssoc (âˆ€ i, f i) where
  ppow_add _ _ _ := by ext; simp [ppow_add]
  ppow_one _ := by ext; simp
```
Thank you.  That looks much nicer.
Just so you know, it's more usual to denote the index type by `Î¹`.
Thank you.  I just copied from Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Pi
Yeah, this is a very old file with strange conventions.

```suggestion
    PNatPowAssoc (M Ã— N) where
  ppow_add _ _ _ := by ext <;> simp [ppow_add]
  ppow_one _ := by ext <;> simp
```

Can we also have
```
theorem ppow_mul' [PNatPowAssoc M] (x : M) (m n : â„•+) : x ^ (m * n) = (x ^ n) ^ m
```
Can you move these to outside the section or at least to the end of it?

```suggestion
section Mul
variable [Mul M] [Pow M â„•+] [PNatPowAssoc M]
```
to make clear that your last lemma can't be in this section

For your information, this can be combined as
```suggestion
  refine PNat.recOn n ?_ fun k hk â†¦ ?_
  rw [ppow_one, mul_one]
```

```suggestion
instance Prod.instPNatPowAssoc {N : Type*} [Mul M] [Pow M â„•+] [PNatPowAssoc M] [Mul N] [Pow N â„•+]
     [PNatPowAssoc N] : PNatPowAssoc (M Ã— N) where
```
